name: mine construction, open cast, lignite | mine infrastructure, open cast, lignite | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9292/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of an opencast mine for lignite mining. Apart from conveyors, tracks and administration buildings, mainly mobile equipment is used. Thus, material consumption depends particularly on service life of machinery and equipment. According to Schlösser, service life is about 40 to 50 years. Taking maintenance requirements into account an average life time of 30 years is assumed in this dataset. Data is based on three opencast mines: Oberdorf (Austria), Kans-Achinsk/Ekibastuz (Russia) and Rheinbraun AG (Germany). Hence, only figures per ton lignite were given in literature and no information about average annual production of lignite in Europe was available. Due to these facts a total production of 100 million tons has been assumed. It has to be considered that this dataset is based on few data about opencast mines thus it may not reflect specific mines. Even with a broader database it would not have been possible to calculate assured mean values. This is due to the fact that there are big differences between mines and complete data of several hundred mines would have been required.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of various construction materials (steel, copper, concrete, plywood) for the construction of an opencast mine for lignite mining.

This activity ends with an opencast mine unit for lignite mining. This dataset includes machinery and equipment with a life time of 30 years because this information is not seperated in the literature given. It also includes requirements for prospecting.This dataset doesn´t include land use because it is not seperated in the available references. Thus, land use is included during operation of the mine.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

exchanges.description:
Estimation. In this dataset specific plywood consumption of 0.03 kg/t pit coal is used. Elevators, cooling systems, processing installations, loading facilities, administration buildings and sanitary installations have to be taken into account. It is not clearly possible to differentiate between data belonging to infrastructure and operation of the mine. Due to this, requirements for wood are included in the infrastructure dataset; the rest of material consumption is considered in the operation dataset.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. In this dataset specific steel consumption of 0.04 kg/t  pit coal is used. Data about steel amount is nearly the same in all given literature sources, thus robust data about steel consumption can be assumed. In Levin a model of an opencast mine is calculated. There, specific steel consumption of 0.152 kg/t is estimated. Elevators, cooling systems, processing installations, loading facilities, administration buildings and sanitary installations have to be taken into account. It is not clearly possible to differentiate between data belonging to infrastructure and operation of the mine. Due to this, requirements for steel are included in the infrastructure dataset; the rest of material consumption is considered in the operation dataset.


Further references:

Pers. Mitteilung von N. Schlösser, Rheinbraun AG, Köln.

Levin B. (1993) CO2-Emissionen von Energiesystemen zur Stromerzeugung unter Berücksichtigung der Energiewandlungsketten. Dissertation TU Berlin.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
Estimation. In this dataset specific copper consumption of 0.007 kg/t pit coal is used. In Levin a model of an opencast mine is calculated. There, data about copper consumption of 0.005 kg/t is estimated. Elevators, cooling systems, processing installations, loading facilities, administration buildings and sanitary installations have to be taken into account. It is not clearly possible to differentiate between data belonging to infrastructure and operation of the mine. Due to this, requirements for copper are included in the infrastructure dataset; the rest of material consumption is considered in the operation dataset.


Further references:

Pers. Mitteilung von N. Schlösser, Rheinbraun AG, Köln.

Levin B. (1993) CO2-Emissionen von Energiesystemen zur Stromerzeugung unter Berücksichtigung der Energiewandlungsketten. Dissertation TU Berlin.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. For general infrastructure 5 kg/t.a reinforced concrete is used which result in a specific value of 0.17 kg/t pit coal. In Levin a model of an opencast mine is calculated. There, specific concrete consumption of 0.105 kg/t is estimated. Elevators, cooling systems, processing installations, loading facilities, administration buildings and sanitary installations have to be taken into account. It is not clearly possible to differentiate between data belonging to infrastructure and operation of the mine. Due to this, requirements for concrete are included in the infrastructure dataset; the rest of material consumption is considered in the operation dataset.


Further references:

Levin B. (1993) CO2-Emissionen von Energiesystemen zur Stromerzeugung unter Berücksichtigung der Energiewandlungsketten. Dissertation TU Berlin.
